com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Class ImagePainter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.ImagePainter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver
public class ImagePainter
extends Object
implements ImageObserver

Utility class for managing image draws. Only one image can be painted at a time but you can conceivably reuse the same ImagePainter for multiple imagery, provided you take care of thread safety yourself

Method Detail

start

public void start(Image image,
                  Graphics g,
                  int dx1,
                  int dy1,
                  int dx2,
                  int dy2,
                  int wd,
                  int ht,
                  boolean dispose)
Starts drawing a new image onto the given graphics context within the specified area, and optionally dispose when finished drawing. ImagObserver is used to manage image retrieval for you, if necessary

Parameters:
image - the image to be drawn - may optionally be retrieved
g - the graphics context
dx1 - the x coordinate of the first corner of the destination rectangle.
dy1 - the y coordinate of the first corner of the destination rectangle.
dx2 - the x coordinate of the second corner of the destination rectangle.
dy2 - the y coordinate of the second corner of the destination rectangle.
wd - the width of the source rectangle.
ht - the height of the source rectangle.
dispose - true == dispose and gc the image when finished drawing, false == otherwise

imageUpdate

public boolean imageUpdate(Image img,
                           int infoflags,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int width,
                           int height)
This method monitors image retrieval.

Specified by:
imageUpdate in interface ImageObserver
Parameters:
img - the image
infoflags - image flags
x - the X ordinate
y - the Y ordinate
width - the image width
height - the image height
Returns:
true if the image was updated, false otherwise
